intro: Psychotria affinis, commonly known as the "Blue Psychotria," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests.
